page.title: 05FARMING AROUND GARTMORE
page.content: {Wester Third Farm}lies between the village and the Kelty Burn. The 220 acres are farmed by Messrs. John and Robert Hamilton. They have about 100 Ayrshire{dairy cows,}and the children own some Suffolk and Cross Leicester sheep. Crops grown are barley, and grass for silage and rough grazing. Recently they have built a modern milk parlour, the cows being milked twice a day at 5.00am and 4.00pm. {Carse of Shannochill Farm}covers 326 acres to the north of the River Forth, from Duchalton Wood to Gartrenich Moss. Mr. John Keir has 100{ewes}and 30{breeding cows,}for beef calves, which are kept outside, and on the very fertile ground he grows{oats and {barley.}The farm is one of three sold from an estate, the others being Nether Shannochill and Over Shannochill.
